Authors: Wijaya R., Christian V., Yuwananda Y.S., Alexander I.
Title: Temperature and humidity monitoring system in server room using raspberry Pi
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Authors with affiliations: Wijaya, R., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Christian, V., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Yuwananda, Y.S., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Alexander, I., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: Server is a vital device and should be given more attention in active state. Important data like database or documents of web application are stored in server. The server must active for a long time and doing a heavy process, if the room temperature is not conducive it can cause a decrease of server performance. Because of this problem we proposed a monitoring system that can be used a solution for this problem. In this research we create a monitoring system using Raspberry Pi and DHT11 sensor. The results obtained that the temperature data received by the sensor are successfully sent and stored into a database using Raspberry Pi, the accuracy results of the DHT11 sensor used is 98.15% and the system successfully sent an e-mail notification when the temperature data received from the sensor passed the normal limit (20°C-25°C). © IJSTR 2019.
Author Keywords: Humidity sensor; Internet; Monitoring; MySQL database; Raspyberry Pi; Server; Temperature sensor
References: Nawale, B., Allurwar, N., Temperature/Humidity Monitoring Webserver (2016) Int. J. Eng. Tech.
